steps.description: Customer submits an enquiry for Siemens industrial equipment via the product page or contact form.
steps.businessRationale: Industrial buyers typically spend time validating product specs before submitting an enquiry; Siemens must ensure fast response to avoid losing high-value leads.

steps.description: Siemens sales engineering team validates technical requirements and confirms feasibility.
steps.businessRationale: Industrial equipment procurement requires technical validation to ensure compatibility with customer infrastructure; delays reduce conversion likelihood.

steps.description: Customer uses Siemens configurator to define equipment specifications and generate pricing.
steps.businessRationale: Complex industrial equipment requires detailed configuration; configurator performance directly impacts quote accuracy and customer satisfaction.

steps.description: Siemens generates a formal quotation including pricing, delivery timelines, and contract terms.
steps.businessRationale: Quotation generation is a key revenue event; delays or errors directly reduce conversion rates for high-value deals.

steps.description: Customer reviews and signs the procurement contract via Siemens digital contract platform.
steps.businessRationale: Contract signing is the final conversion step; digital signature performance and reliability are critical for revenue recognition.

steps.description: Siemens schedules delivery, performs installation, and hands over equipment to the customer.
steps.businessRationale: Industrial equipment delivery and installation typically take 1â€“3 days; timely delivery impacts customer satisfaction and future procurement likelihood.
